intro: Scorzonera woronowii, commonly known as the Siberian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped tubers that are often used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera woronowii thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, typically at high altitudes. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is also cultivated for ornamental purposes.
